definition: to replace sb (personnel, sports team player etc)/substitution
to exchange/to change (clothes etc)/to substitute/to switch/to convert (currency)
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]

sentences.english: Somehow, I just don''t like to change horses in the middle of the stream.
sentences.chinese: 不知什麼緣故，我就是不喜歡中途換人。

sentences.english: Because I don't want to have to fill this position again in six months.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我不想在六個月內另換人手。

sentences.english: Can one be replaced before the case is ultimately decided?
sentences.chinese: 在最後判決之前，這些法官是否有可能換人？

sentences.english: Play an entire game using manual substitutions, in a non-simulated game.
sentences.chinese: 在一場非模擬比賽，以手動換人完成一場比賽。

sentences.english: Don't replace scaffolder during dismantle the scaffolding without justly reason.
sentences.chinese: 沒有充分的理由，腳手架拆除過程中不可換人。

sentences.english: The third and final change was that of Tosto for Raggi.
sentences.chinese: 第三次也是最後一次換人是由特斯托換下了拉吉。

definition: unalterable/certainly/definitely
conversely/in reverse order/in an opposite direction
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
see 未可厚非[wei4 ke3 hou4 fei1]
to enjoy market dominance/to monopolize
to examine or inspect/self-criticism/review
to say again/to put off a discussion until later/moreover/what's more/besides
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
final conclusion/accepted argument
outcome/result/conclusion/in the end/as a result/to kill/to dispatch
to bear fruit/CL:個|个[ge4]
to come apart
labor and capital/labor and management
automatic/voluntarily
to have nothing to say (idiom)
